item.title: “This war is [Vladimir] Putin’s way of testing the democratic world and it is an attempt to break our democratic spirit,” writes the president of Kosovo. Instead, @VjosaOsmaniPRKS argues, it has done the opposite https://t.co/mB5lRlOito
Russia faces a deep recession. But rather than relent, Vladimir Putin may double down on his attempts to cut the country off from the outside world https://t.co/r33Jbfk2DP
If Russia triumphs, it is likely to be through sheer mass https://t.co/RylVJMe8SY

“Russia’s president pursues a dangerous imperialist policy that permits one country to choose the fate of another simply because it has the military might,” says @VjosaOsmaniPRKS https://t.co/NQZha4gQMI
“We don't let the Russians relax”: life inside the Georgian Legion by @Wendell23 for @1843mag https://t.co/oYiFgmqLAI
Emmanuel Macron looks to be in prime position to win re-election. Our model finds him the overwhelming favourite https://t.co/Pz0FlKWLVw
Harrison, an American volunteer, left his wife and his job with the Chicago police department behind to fight in Ukraine https://t.co/wx0AEVfQdM
The EU now estimates that up to 7m people may seek refuge abroad https://t.co/ZnbCFQVTr3
The official global toll is 6m. But we find that there is a 95% chance that the true value lies between 14m and 23.7m additional deaths https://t.co/e3B65pAy4U
As Russia sinks, the contrast with the president next door is glaring. Volodymyr Zelensky is Vladimir Putin’s antithesis—and perhaps his nemesis https://t.co/KstlQod9nb

Ukraine has destroyed, damaged or captured at least 1,054 pieces of Russian equipment, about four times as many as it has lost to Russia, say analysts.
These figures are far from perfect, but read how they provide a glimpse through the fog of war ⬇️
These weapons can destroy delicate lung tissue or force air into the bloodstream, causing a massive embolism without leaving external signs of injury https://t.co/xDuzrR96tz
Also know as “vacuum bombs”, these horrifying weapons can suck the air out of victims’ lungs https://t.co/J4Yhq873oO
The military difficulties the Russians are having may lead China to rethink the feasibility of an invasion across the Taiwan strait https://t.co/x15S5GnF76
They have been mockingly dubbed by Western analysts as “emotional-support armour” or “cope cages” https://t.co/pEoZz5jvO6

Vladimir Putin is a “pathological liar”, writes Lithuania’s prime minister @IngridaSimonyte. The West was too delusional in its negotiations with him, and “Russian money smelled too good” https://t.co/9wPo3qlg4A
“Becoming a refugee is no-one’s first choice. It’s always the last.” Nobel peace-prize laureate @Malala discusses the impact of war on education, on “The Economist Asks” https://t.co/ychxAMOLBu

“The appeasement of autocrats today only emboldens them tomorrow,” writes @VjosaOsmaniPRKS. The president of Kosovo argues that concessions to tyrants never bring lasting peace https://t.co/LrT8dYi4i4

Tech-savvy Ukrainians are helping the war effort.
Meet one of the cyber-warriors taking down Russian websites. A thread 👇 https://t.co/TCtThhmexu https://t.co/8PXLWYitX2

“These girls are not just there to tell us their stories and how difficult their life has been, but they also know the solutions to the problems that we confront.” @Malala explains why educating girls is the key to social progress, on “The Economist Asks” https://t.co/gGYjxtN4Qx

⚡️There are more than 300,000 members of the official “IT Army” of Ukraine, a Telegram group of volunteer cyber-warriors set up by the government, and an increasing number of unofficial groups.
Their aim is to spread chaos in Russia 👇 https://t.co/JHwW3pK7pY
It had been widely assumed by defence analysts and officials that Russia would quickly destroy Ukraine’s air force. That didn’t happen https://t.co/qZ0Ih4KvWC

“As Russian misbehaviour has been growing in recent years, NATO has been exercising its responses methodically,” writes Rose @Gottemoeller in a guest commentary for The Economist https://t.co/q2yyvCbOrx
“We are in an extremely dangerous situation, and Western policy is exacerbating these risks,” warns the political scientist in a guest essay for The Economist https://t.co/pTnPJq41qo
But they seem to be pretty-much useless https://t.co/FWECPCIrDs
The political scientist believes the reckless expansion of NATO provoked Russia. Writing in a guest essay for The Economist, he explains why https://t.co/1BkcQBKTal

This map shows the reported areas of Russian control and advances in Ukraine.
Kyiv, the capital, has so far held off Russian forces. But the invaders have nearly surrounded the city. Read the latest update on the crisis ⬇️

“While the eyes of the world are rightly focused on Ukraine,” @VjosaOsmaniPRKS says there is another “significant threat rumbling beneath the surface”. She warns that through Serbia, Vladimir Putin has “his claws deeply and firmly entrenched in our region” https://t.co/9QveM8u61F
Britain has welcomed dirty money for too long, says Oliver Bullough in his new book, “Butler to the World”. That might be about to change https://t.co/58QboJAhp2
Is support for Vladimir Putin waning? The outcome of the war depends on the mood in Moscow as well as the fighting near Kyiv https://t.co/tPvlNz1uyH
If Russia triumphs, it is likely to be through sheer mass https://t.co/V5QCOLwa7A
“We are in an extremely dangerous situation, and Western policy is exacerbating these risks,” warns the political scientist in a guest essay for The Economist https://t.co/gcLTGNawCt
For eight consecutive days Russia agreed to a ceasefire to allow evacuations from the city, only to break it https://t.co/oAO3UsTI4U

Serbia’s rejection of sanctions against Russia is “no surprise”, argues Vjosa Osmani, Kosovo’s president, in a guest commentary for The Economist. She warns the country’s shift towards autocracy has been “gradual and, crucially, deliberate” https://t.co/NF8cKoBH8Y
Jake Priday spent six years in the British army. He arrived in Ukraine to help in the war effort – and left just nine hours later https://t.co/q85R8UjhLH

Nearly three weeks into Vladimir Putin’s reckless campaign, Ukraine has destroyed, damaged or captured at least 1,054 pieces of Russian equipment, about four times as many as it has lost to Russia. https://t.co/8jkjYSzZvc

This map shows the reported areas of Russian control and advances in Ukraine.
Kyiv, the capital, has so far held off Russian forces. But the invaders have nearly surrounded the city. Read the latest update on the crisis ⬇️

Europe’s stance towards refugees has dramatically shifted in comparison to previous crises. Racism is surely a factor; as is the fact that Ukrainian refugees are mostly women and children https://t.co/lP6TedIa49
Vadym Boychenko, Mariupol’s mayor says that at least 2,187 civilians have died, but that many areas of the city are too dangerous to enter to provide a proper tally https://t.co/DGk347DelJ
For China, it is always about Chinese interests. Such self­-absorption is good for domestic morale. It is a perilous way to calculate risks https://t.co/zKpIkGgx36
They cause air to be sucked towards the point of explosion, hence the grim moniker of “vacuum bomb” https://t.co/WuZvtM0ccx

“My generation is passionate about protecting our planet, but many of us aren’t equipped with adequate knowledge or skills to handle the problems we’ll soon inherit.” @vanessa_vash explains why “gender-equal climate education” is part of the solution https://t.co/lbOvF3JiJi
Unable to fly equipment in, Ukraine’s allies must send it across the same borders that refugees are struggling to cross https://t.co/3umj0chfpm

Vladimir Putin is a “pathological liar”, writes Lithuania’s prime minister @IngridaSimonyte. The West was too delusional in its negotiations with him, and “Russian money smelled too good” https://t.co/KSzFfGxDiQ
Some 50,000 people in New South Wales have recently been forced to evacuate after a dam spilled over https://t.co/9Xf7bD7yeT
There is no outcome in Ukraine that will stop the outrages that take place within Russia at the hands of Vladimir Putin’s regime https://t.co/sBgqDZojiu

The truth is sinking in that, by attacking Ukraine, Vladimir Putin has committed a catastrophic error. As the scale of his failure becomes clear, Russia will enter the most dangerous moment in this conflict https://t.co/SRIDLpmvvh
Cheers for Russia are amplified by censors whose eagle eyes and algorithms help to suppress other views https://t.co/J4HLqQXVjV
America has the highest death rate from covid-19 among rich countries: nearly double the average https://t.co/qlzAMFfvQE
By insisting that Vladimir Putin’s military “operation” is de-Nazifying Ukraine, state television is re-Stalinising Russia https://t.co/pyuiS8ce1L
